intro: Xanthophyllum hildebrandii, commonly known as the Hildebrand's goldenleaf, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow leaves and small, clustered yellow-orange flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to thrive in cool, moist environments. Its foliage is covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Xanthophyllum hildebrandii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
